Package com.jelly.json

Class JSONObject

java.lang.Object
com.jelly.json.JSONObject
public final class JSONObject extends Object
Runtime-Representation of the object type in JSON.

This class is implemented as an HashMap-Delegator with additional type-checking and an enhanced toString() method to generate a valid JSON-String to represent this JSONObject.

Author:
Tom Berends

  • Method Details

    • set

      public void set​(String fieldName, Object value)
      General method to set a field in JSONObject.

      Note that additional type-checking is needed in order to only allow valid JSON-Types to be set.

      For each valid JSON-Type there is a separate method that gets called by this method.

      Parameters:
      fieldName - name of the field to be set.
      value - value the field is to be set to.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is not a valid JSON-Type.
      See Also:
      set(String, boolean), set(String, int), set(String, float), set(String, String), set(String, JSONObject), set(String, JSONArray)

    • get

    • getBoolean

      public boolean getBoolean​(String fieldName)
      Returns the value of the field with the specified name cast to a boolean value.

      If the type of the value of the specified field is unknown the more general get(String) method should be called as this method throws an Exception when the Object at the specified position cannot be cast to a boolean value.

      Parameters:
      fieldName - the name of the field.
      Returns:
      the value of the field with the specified name.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the Object at the specified position cannot be cast to a boolean value.
      See Also:
      get(String)

    • getInteger
